name: Precipice of Darkness, Episode Two
description: On the Rain-Slick Precipice of Darkness, Episode Two is the second installment in the RPG-adventure game series based on the web comic Penny Arcade. Whether you're a fan of the first installment or new to the series, you'll be able to pick up and play Episode Two as a standalone experience.
minimum_requirements: Supported OS: Microsoft Windows® 2000/XP/Vista™                    Processor: Pentium® III, AMDAthlon™ 1.0 GHz or better                    System Memory: 512 MB of available system memory                    Video Card: ATI Radeon™ 9500 or better, NVIDIA GeForce™ FX 5200 or better, Intel® GMA 950 or better with 64 MB of video memory (shared or dedicated)*                    Sound Card: Windows supported sound card                    Hard Disk: 350 MB of available hard drive space                                         *video cards require latest drivers supporting OpenGL.

reviews.review_text: Very funny writing, although the story is a bit all over the place. Nice combat, but a bit simplistic, love the pseudo paper mario style jrpg thing. A good amount of content, about 8-9 hours or so. Really enjoying it.

Gameplay is similar to the first one so if you liked Episode One, you should get Episode Two! Same main characters with some new attacks and weapon modifications but the main thing is seeing the story continue to unfold! This game has a bit more profanity than the first one but beyond that still a lot of fun to play this combination point-and-click and RPG adventure.
get this with number 1, ♥♥♥♥ the 3rd ep.
Top stuff, it's a damn shame this series was cancelled!

Episode 2 done.  Hoes, Double Barrle Shotguns, Fists of Fury! Fighting MONKEYS. MECHA ROBOT BATTLE! What more could you want from a game.   Sadly, as the protagonist you are still without a place to call home. First a giant robot, then a truck. What next. You finally find a place and it gets burned down to the ground. As the anger dwells inside you the more powerful you and your hoe become!.   As you complete this episode, one thought continually crosses your mind, whats the plan, where am I going to sleep tonight.  Worth playing in my opinion. Just be sure to play through Episode 1 before picking up Episode 2. As your quest to find a bed to sleep on and shelter to keep you warm continue,  Cya next time in Ep 3.

When I first started this game, it looked really good! I loved the artwork and the style of the game sucked you in. It wasn't until the first fight that I started to not want to play anymore. It wasn't the fight sceen and it wasn't the action. That is where they started cussing. The action started with the S word and then the F word got put in a couple of times. I would love to go through the game without those words. So unfortunaly I cannot recommend this. If there were a way to turn that off, it would be fantastic!

If you liked Chapter 1 get this, otherwise don't bother. The RPG features are nothing to write home about, the story is a bit 'lost' if you haven't played Chapter 1, only the humor (for Penny Arcade fans) saves this game.
The battles are longer and it's a good extension of the first, even if this playstyle does get a bit old. Also, WORDS.
